intro: Serpaea rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf serpaea, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible rhubarb-like stems. The plant is characterized by its round, succulent leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in cold, rocky environments and is adapted to withstand harsh winter conditions. Serpaea rotundifolia plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing food for various herbivores and supporting local biodiversity.
